revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|yellowish|ly}} ===Adverb=== {{en-adv}} # With a colour resembling [[yellow]]. #* '''1873''', John Soelberg Wells, ''A Treatise on the Diseases of the Eye'', Lindsay & Blakiston, [http://books.google.ca/books?id=s-gnGmeMQKAC&pg=PA750&dq=%22thinned+and+yellowishly+discoloured%22&client=firefox-a#v=onepage&q=%22thinned%20and%20yellowishly%20discoloured%22&f=false p. 750]: #*: The skin becomes thinned and '''yellowishly''' discoloured at one point, gives way, and a large quantity of thick creamy pus escapes. #* '''2002''', [[w:Richard Zenith|Richard Zenith]] (translator), [[w:Fernando Pessoa|Fernando Pessoa]] (author), ''The Book of Disquiet'', {{ISBN|9780141183046}}, [http://books.google.ca/books?id=PbxzuKOzEJcC&pg=PA196&dq=%22yellowishly+darkened+by+an+expiring%22&client=firefox-a#v=onepage&q=%22yellowishly%20darkened%20by%20an%20expiring%22&f=false p. 196]: #*: . . . a sky with every fading colour: blue-green, pale grey between green and blue, fuzzy hues of distant clouds that aren't clouds, '''yellowishly''' darkened by an expiring red. #* '''2004''', [[w:Ross Thomas (author)|Ross Thomas]], ''Chinaman's Chance'', {{ISBN|9780312334147}}, p. 209: #*: Ploughman silently studied the two men for a moment or two longer, then smiled '''yellowishly''', opened a desk drawer, and brought out a bottle of Gordon's gin.
